title: JSW Group’s JSW Cement gets Sebi nod for ₹4000 crore IPO; details here | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
JSW Cement Secures Approval for ₹4000 Crore IPO from Sebi

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

JSW Cement Limited has received final observation from SEBI to raise ₹4000 crore through an initial public offering (IPO), following its application submitted on August 16.

  1. The IPO consists of a fresh issue of up to ₹2000 crore and an offer for sale of the same amount by Investor Selling Shareholders.
  2. Key shareholders involved in the offer for sale include AP Asia Opportunistic Holdings Pte. Ltd. and Synergy Metals Investments Holding Limited.
  3. Funds raised will partially finance a new cement facility in Nagaur, Rajasthan.
  4. JSW Cement is recognized as one of India's fastest-growing cement companies as per CRISIL.
  5. In FY 2023, the company reported a 31.11% increase in sales volume, significantly surpassing the industry average growth of 6.35%.
  6. The IPO is being managed by several book-running lead managers including JM Financial Limited and Goldman Sachs (India) Securities Private Limited.
"JSW Cement is one of the fastest cement manufacturing companies in India in terms of increased installed grinding capacity and sales volume from Fiscal 2014 to Fiscal 2024." - CRISIL Report

The move to raise capital marks a significant step for JSW Cement in expanding its operations and enhancing its market share in the competitive Indian cement industry.
newTitle: JSW Cement Secures Approval for ₹4000 Crore IPO from Sebi

title: HCL Tech Q3 Results Live Updates: HCL Tech posts 5.5% growth, announces Rs 18 dividend - The Financial Express
summary:
HCL Tech Quarterly Earnings and Results Live Updates

Date: January 13, 2025 Source: Financial Express

HCL Tech has reported a net profit of Rs 4,591 crore for the fiscal third quarter, representing a year-on-year growth of 5.54%. Revenue from operations was recorded at Rs 29,890 crore, marking a 5.08% increase compared to the previous year. The company has also declared a dividend of Rs 18 per equity share for the financial year 2024-25, which includes a special dividend in celebration of its 25 years of public listing.

  • Net profit for Q3 FY25: Rs 4,591 crore, up 5.54% YoY
  • Revenue from operations: Rs 29,890 crore, up 5.08% YoY
  • Fourth interim dividend announced: Rs 18 per share
  • Attrition rate increased to 13.2%
  • New deal TCV for Q3: $2,095 million
“HCLTech is well positioned as AI-led transformation brings new opportunities for growth.” - Roshni Nadar Malhotra, Chairperson, HCL Tech

The third quarter results indicate a steady growth trajectory for HCL Tech, amidst economic challenges, highlighting its strong position in the IT sector.
newTitle: HCL Tech Q3 Results: Profit Increases by 5.54% to Rs 4,591 Crore; Dividend Declared

title: HCL Tech Q3 Results: PAT grows 6% YoY to Rs 4,591 crore, revenue up 5%, Rs 18 dividend declared - The Economic Times
HCL Tech Q3 Results: Net profit rises 5.5% to ₹4,591 crore, revenue up 5% YoY; dividend declared | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
HCL Tech Q3 Results: Net profit rises 5.5% to ₹4,591 crore, revenue up 5% YoY; dividend declared

Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

HCL Technologies reported a 5.5% increase in net profit and a 5% rise in revenue for the Q3FY25. The company also declared a dividend as it marks 25 years since its public listing.

  • Consolidated net profit reached ₹4,591 crore.
  • Revenue from operations for Q3FY25 rose to ₹29,890 crore.
  • Interim dividend declared: ₹18 per share, including a special dividend of ₹6.
  • New deal wins for the quarter were $2.1 billion.
  • Updated revenue growth forecast for FY25 is now 4.5% to 5% in constant currency.
“HCL Tech is well positioned as AI-led transformation brings new opportunities for growth.” - Roshni Nadar, Chairperson, HCL Tech

The results reflect HCL Tech's strong performance and confidence in future growth driven by AI and digital offerings.
newTitle: HCL Tech Q3 Results: Profit and Revenue Growth Noted

title: Stock market crash: 5 reasons why Sensex tanked by over 1,000 points - Hindustan Times
summary:
Stock market crash: The Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) benchmark index Sensex tanked by 1,048.90 points to close at 76,330

Date: Jan 13, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

On January 13, 2025, the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) saw a significant drop in the Sensex index, falling by over 1,000 points due to various negative market influences.

  • The crash was largely attributed to unfavorable global market cues.
  • Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) sold off equities worth ₹2,254.68 crore.
  • The rupee fell to a historic low against the US dollar, exacerbating market conditions.
  • Brent crude oil prices surged above $80 a barrel, raising inflation concerns.
  • Upcoming budget expectations contributed to a restrained market sentiment.
“Rising crude oil prices would raise concerns of a spike in domestic inflation, which could further delay any rate cut hopes from the RBI in the near to medium term.” – Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd

This dramatic drop in the stock market reflects broader economic uncertainties and highlights the interconnectedness of global events affecting domestic markets.
newTitle: Reasons Behind the 1,000 Point Drop in Sensex

title: PSU Bank index is down 26% from its peak — These lenders offer the biggest upside - CNBCTV18
summary:
PSU Bank index is down 26% from its peak — These lenders offer the biggest upside

Publication Date: January 13, 2024 Source: CNBC TV18

The Nifty PSU Bank index has slipped 26% from its peak on June 3 and is exhibiting potential for recovery among several key state-owned lenders.

  • The PSU Bank index declined an additional 3% on January 13, marking four consecutive days of losses.
  • All 12 constituents of the index have experienced declines of 20% to 40% since June 3.
  • Top-performing stocks such as SBI have a projected upside of 33% after a 20% decline.
  • Union Bank has faced the most significant loss at 41%, offset by the highest projected upside of 43%.
“These state-run lenders have corrected between 20% to 40% but offer the highest upside potential post this fall.”

This situation presents a mixed bag for investors; while stock prices have dipped, analysts foresee potential recoveries for many PSU Bank stocks, making this a critical time for strategic investments.
newTitle: PSU Bank Index Down 26%: Opportunities for Investors

title: Why rupee breached 86 against US dollar: strengthening dollar, weak FII inflows - The Indian Express
summary:
Why the Rupee Breached 86 Against US Dollar: Strengthening Dollar, Weak FII Inflows

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Indian Express

The rupee fell past the 86 mark against the US dollar on account of a strengthening dollar and weakening foreign institutional investor inflows, amid rising crude oil prices.

  • The rupee opened at 86.12 and hit a low of 86.31 against the dollar.
  • Factors leading to this depreciation include a strong dollar and high crude oil prices.
  • The US jobs report showed NFP at 256,000, outpacing expectations.
  • Capital outflows from Indian markets have reached approximately $4.2 billion in January 2025.
  • The rupee is expected to trade within the range of 85.80–86.50 in the near term.
“This sustained decline reflects a combination of global and domestic pressures.” - Amit Pabari, Managing Director, CR Forex Advisors
newTitle: Why the Rupee Fell Past 86 Against the US Dollar

title: Nithin Kamath to Shankar Sharma: How stock market mavens reacted to today's Sensex crash | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Reactions from Stock Market Experts on Today's Sensex Crash

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

The stock market experienced a significant downturn, with analysts and investors expressing their sentiments on the unprecedented sell-off that impacted all indices.

  • The Sensex fell by 1.36%, settling at 76,330.01.
  • The Nifty dropped by 1.47%, ending at 23,085.95.
  • Mid-cap and small-cap stocks plunged by around 4% each.
  • A total of ₹13 lakh crore was wiped off from investor wealth.
  • Nithin Kamath shared a grimacing emoji and a screenshot of the market, reflecting widespread losses.
  • Shankar Sharma humorously tweeted about losing his shirt in the market.
  • Deepak Shenoy suggested that market corrections could provide buying opportunities for long-term investors.
"Lost my shirt in the market today." — Shankar Sharma
"Markets are brutal sometimes, but strong down days are usually a good sign of capitulation." — Deepak Shenoy

This crash has raised concerns among investors but also highlights potential opportunities for those looking to invest long-term.
newTitle: Reactions from Stock Market Experts on Today's Sensex Crash

title: Indian state rations Kingfisher beer after Heineken turns off taps in price row - The Economic Times
summary:
Telangana Rations Kingfisher Beer Amid Heineken Price Dispute

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Reuters

India's largest beer-consuming state, Telangana, is rationing Kingfisher beer supplies after United Breweries' sales suspension over price disputes with Heineken.

  • Telangana is implementing rationing to prevent hoarding and manage shortages, as indicated by local retailers.
  • United Breweries halted sales due to delayed payments and lack of approval for price increases since 2019.
  • The alcohol market in India is under stress, with multiple companies demanding payment for dues.
  • Kingfisher beer stock among liquor outlets varies, with some having only two days left.
  • United Breweries holds a 70% market share in Telangana's beer sector.
“Today we got a notification from our depot that there is no Kingfisher beer stock anymore,” - Madhusudhan Rao, liquor store owner.

This situation highlights the ongoing regulatory challenges and market pressures faced by alcohol manufacturers in India.
newTitle: Telangana Rations Kingfisher Beer Amid Heineken Price Dispute

title: Nifty Prediction for Tuesday, Jan 14: Can BULLS hold 23000 after breakdown from symmetrical triangle pattern? - ET Now
summary:
Nifty Prediction for Tuesday, Jan 14

Updated: Jan 13, 2025, 17:07 IST | Source: ET NOW

A bearish sentiment prevailed in the market, with both Sensex and Nifty closing lower for the fourth consecutive session. This article discusses the implications of the recent downturn and the critical support levels for the Nifty index.

  • The Nifty index opened gap down and closed at 23,085.95, down 345.55 points or 1.47%.
  • A negative candle formation indicates a decisive downside breakout from a symmetrical triangle pattern.
  • Immediate support at 23,260 has been violated, signaling potential further declines.
  • Market analysts predict a further slide to support levels around 22,800-22,700.
  • Key level to watch: if Nifty holds above 23,000, a potential recovery may be on the horizon.
“The underlying trend of Nifty continues to be weak.” - Nagaraj Shetti, Senior Technical Research Analyst at HDFC Securities.

The market is experiencing increased bearishness, with crucial levels being breached. Future movements hinge on whether the index can sustain above the 23,000 mark.
newTitle: Nifty Prediction for Jan 14: Can BULLS Hold 23000 After Breakdown?

title: L&T's HR head breaks silence on chairman's controversial 90-hour work week remarks - The Economic Times
Oil jumps on expected hit to China and India's Russian supplies - Reuters
summary:
Oil Prices Surge as Sanctions Hit Russian Supplies to China and India

Date: January 13, 2024 Source: Reuters

Oil prices have hit their highest levels in several months, driven by new U.S. sanctions on Russian oil, particularly affecting top buyers China and India.

  • Brent crude exceeds $80 per barrel for the first time in over four months.
  • U.S. sanctions targeting Russian producers and vessels contribute to supply disruptions.
  • Chinese and Indian refiners are seeking alternative sources of crude oil.
"There are genuine fears in the market about supply disruption. The worst case scenario for Russian oil is looking like it could be the realistic scenario," said PVM analyst Tamas Varga.

This surge in oil prices reflects broader geopolitical tensions and market reactions to the unfolding sanctions.
newTitle: Oil Prices Surge as Sanctions Hit Russian Supplies to China and India

title: UK throws its hat into the AI fire - TechCrunch
summary:
UK Government Plans Major Investment in AI for National Renewal

Publication Date: November 1, 2023 | Source: TechCrunch

In 2023, the U.K. government has shifted its stance on artificial intelligence (AI), announcing a sweeping plan that includes substantial investments to establish the country as a leader in AI technology. This initiative aims to address public sector challenges and create new jobs in the burgeoning AI sector.

  • The U.K. government revealed a “Plan for Change” aimed at investing in AI to enhance public services and establish geographic “AI Growth Zones.”
  • Private tech firms have committed to investing £14 billion ($17 billion) and creating over 13,000 jobs as part of this initiative.
  • Details include the establishment of the first “AI Growth Zone” in Culham, Oxfordshire, and plans to increase public compute capacity by twentyfold.
  • A new National Data Library will be created to store and utilize public data for AI development.
  • The government emphasizes its commitment to AI following prior recommendations from venture capitalist Matt Clifford.
“Artificial Intelligence will drive incredible change in our country,” Prime Minister Keir Starmer stated.

The U.K. aims to modernize its economy by focusing on the AI sector, hoping to regain economic sovereignty amidst global competition.
newTitle: UK Government Plans Major Investment in AI for National Renewal

title: 'Hoist with his own petard': Congress mocks PM Modi as rupee hits all-time low - The Times of India
summary:
Congress Mocks PM Modi as Rupee Hits Record Low

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

The Indian rupee has hit an all-time low, leading Congress members to criticize Prime Minister Modi's economic management.

  • The rupee has depreciated significantly against the US dollar, causing widespread economic concern.
  • Congress leaders highlighted the government's failures in managing the economy.
  • Critics argue that the depreciation reflects poor fiscal policies.
“Such economic mismanagement will have dire consequences for everyone.”

This situation prompts a reevaluation of current economic strategies to stabilize the currency and regain public confidence.
newTitle: Congress Mocks PM Modi as Rupee Hits Record Low

title: Retail inflation eases to four-month low of 5.22% in December - Moneycontrol
summary:
Retail Inflation Drops to Four-Month Low of 5.22% in December

Publication Date: January 13, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

India's inflation declined to a four-month low of 5.22 percent in December as food prices provided some reprieve.

  • Inflation reached 5.22% in December, down from 5.48% in November.
  • Food inflation eased below 9% for the first time in four months.
  • This marks the fourth consecutive month of inflation above 5%.
  • High inflation has influenced the Reserve Bank of India’s policy decisions.
"High inflation has been one of the reasons that the Reserve Bank of India has refused to budge on policy change."

This decline in inflation signifies a positive trend for the Indian economy, providing hope for better economic conditions ahead.
newTitle: Retail Inflation Drops to Four-Month Low of 5.22% in December

title: Asian Paints to Tata Steel- 500 stocks hit 1-year lows on BSE; investors lose ₹13 lakh crore in a day | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Major Stock Market Plunge: 500 Stocks Hit 1-Year Lows on BSE, Investors Lose ₹13 Lakh Crore

Date: January 13, 2023 | Source: Live Mint

An across-the-board sharp selloff in the Indian stock market led to over 500 stocks hitting their one-year lows, resulting in an immense loss of nearly ₹13 lakh crore for investors in a single trading session.

  • 508 stocks, including major companies such as Asian Paints, Tata Steel, and YES Bank, reached their 52-week lows on the BSE.
  • The Sensex dropped 1049 points or 1.36%, while the Nifty 50 fell by 346 points or 1.47%.
  • The overall market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms plunged, making investors poorer by around ₹13 lakh crore.
  • Global market sell-offs influenced the downturn, with US economic data suggesting fewer cuts in interest rates for 2025.
  • The market has seen continued declines with a significant 2.4% drop in the Sensex over four days.
“Expect volatility in the near term, with the 2025 budget, Q3 results, RBI policy, and Trump's policies being key factors in defining the trend in the short term.” - Vinod Nair, Head of Research at Geojit Financial Services

The ongoing volatility raises concerns for investors as market sentiment weakens amidst economic uncertainties.
newTitle: Major Stock Market Plunge: 500 Stocks Hit 1-Year Lows on BSE, Investors Lose ₹13 Lakh Crore

title: India’s retail inflation eases to 5.22% in Dec from 5.48% in Nov on easing food costs - The Economic Times
summary:
India's Retail Inflation Drops to 5.22% in December on Eased Food Costs

Publication Date: December 2023 Source: Economic Times

India's retail inflation eased to 5.22% in December from 5.48% in November, driven by moderating food prices due to a successful harvest.

  • Food inflation shows signs of cooling due to a bumper summer crop harvest.
  • Inflation is not expected to hit the central bank’s 4% target until at least 2026.
  • Food prices constitute a significant part of the consumer price index (CPI).
  • The RBI has downgraded growth forecasts while raising inflation estimates.
  • An impending revision of the CPI basket may reduce food's weightage, contributing to inflation stability.
“High inflation reduces the disposable income in the hands of consumers.” - Shaktikanta Das, former RBI Governor

The gradual easing of inflation offers hope for economic stability, but concerns remain regarding food prices and global economic factors.
newTitle: India's Retail Inflation Drops to 5.22% in December on Eased Food Costs

Afcons Infrastructure secures ₹4,787 crore Pune Ring Road project - CNBCTV18
summary:
Afcons Infrastructure secures ₹4,787 crore Pune Ring Road project

Publication Date: January 13, 2024
Source: CNBC-TV18

Afcons Infrastructure Ltd has been awarded a major project to construct portions of the Pune Ring Road, positioning itself as the lowest bidder for the work.

  • Afcons Infrastructure has secured a ₹4,787.20 crore project from the MSRDC for Access Controlled Pune Ring Road (East) Packages PRR E5 and E7.
  • The project construction will be carried out under the EPC mode and is set for completion in 36 months.
  • Package PRR E5 costs ₹2,718.50 crore, while Package PRR E7 is valued at ₹2,068.70 crore.
  • Afcons Infrastructure has secured orders worth ₹19,000 crore up to September 2024 and anticipates an additional ₹5,000 crore by year-end.
  • In the past year, the company has been awarded contracts totaling ₹8,000-10,000 crore in Maharashtra.
"We are pleased to announce that Afcons Infrastructure Limited has emerged as the Lowest bidder (L1) for the tender invited for the work of construction of the Access Controlled Pune Ring Road."

The successful tender for the Pune Ring Road project underscores Afcons Infrastructure's growing order book and potential for future projects.
newTitle: Afcons Infrastructure Wins ₹4,787 Crore Pune Ring Road Project

Sensex Crashes 1,100 Points, Investors Lose Over 14 Lakh Crore; Why Is Market Falling? - News18
summary:
Sensex Crashes 1,100 Points, Investors Lose Over 14 Lakh Crore; Why Is Market Falling?

Date: January 13, 2025

Source: News18

Indian equity indices BSE Sensex and Nifty50 plummeted on Monday, driven primarily by a strong US jobs report and concerns over slowing earnings growth, which dampened market sentiment.

  • The BSE Sensex fell over 1,100 points to a low of 76,250.
  • Market capitalization across all BSE-listed companies decreased by Rs 14.54 lakh crore.
  • Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) sold equities worth over Rs 21,350 crore in January.
  • Global crude oil prices surged, straining India's fiscal health.
  • The Indian rupee hit an all-time low of Rs 86.27 against the US dollar.
“Markets are under pressure due to multiple headwinds,” said VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services.

The steep market decline reflects broader economic pressures, including weakening corporate earnings and foreign selling, ultimately creating a challenging environment for investors.
newTitle: Sensex Experiences Dramatic Drop of 1,100 Points Amid Investor Losses

title: Gold bulls remain on the sidelines amid reduced Fed rate cut bets - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Bulls Remain Cautious Amid Fed's Rate Cut Doubts

Publication Date: December 10, 2023 | Source: FXStreet

Gold prices are experiencing slight bearish pressure as traders adjust their expectations in light of hawkish signals from the Federal Reserve, despite ongoing geopolitical tensions supporting demand for the safe-haven asset.

  • Gold is facing selling pressure at the start of the week, following a four-day rally.
  • The recent Nonfarm Payrolls report strengthens the likelihood of the Fed maintaining its rate cut stance.
  • Rising US bond yields and a strong dollar contribute to the pressure on gold prices.
  • Geopolitical tensions continue to generate a risk-off mood, limiting losses for gold.
  • Investors are awaiting US inflation data for further direction.
“The yield on the benchmark 10-year US government bond has spiked to its highest level since late 2023.”

The outlook for gold remains mixed as bullish and bearish factors balance each other; traders are encouraged to monitor key economic indicators for clearer trends.
newTitle: Gold Bulls Remain Cautious Amid Fed's Rate Cut Doubts

title: Elara Capital initiates coverage on Vishal Mega Mart with buy rating at Rs 140 target price - The Economic Times
summary:
Elara Capital Initiates Coverage on Vishal Mega Mart with a Buy Rating

Publication Date: 2023-10-23 Source: ETMarkets.com

Elara Capital has initiated coverage on Vishal Mega Mart, offering a 'buy' rating with a target price of Rs 140 per share, citing strong growth potential and efficient operations despite some growth risks.

  • Elara Capital predicts a potential upside of over 35% from current stock levels.
  • The company operates 645 stores across 414 cities and plans to expand to 846 stores by FY27.
  • Vishal Mega Mart's revenue is projected to grow at a CAGR of 19.2% through FY27.
  • Key risks include slower growth rates and supply chain challenges.
“This loyal customer base is projected to expand at a 17% CAGR through FY27,” - Elara Capital.

The coverage signals confidence in Vishal Mega Mart's ability to capture market share in India's retail sector.
newTitle: Elara Capital Initiates Buy Rating for Vishal Mega Mart at Rs 140 Target Price
